Package fr.cnrs.iees.graph

Interface NodeSet<N extends Node>

  • Type Parameters:
    N - The Node subclass used to construct the graph
    All Superinterfaces:
    fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Graph<N,​E>, Tree<N>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ALGraph, SimpleTree, TreeGraph
    public interface NodeSet<N extends Node>
extends fr.ens.biologie.generic.Textable

    The set of nodes of a graph. Graph G is defined as G=(N,E,f) where N is a set of nodes, E a set of edges connecting the nodes, and f the incidence function mapping every edge to a pair of nodes.

    A NodeSet must be associated with an NodeFactory.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 14 mai 2019

    • Method Detail

      • nodes

        java.util.Collection<N> nodes()
        Read-only accessor to all Nodes.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable collection of all Nodes

      • leaves

        default java.util.Collection<N> leaves()
        Read-only accessor to all leaf nodes (if any). A leaf node is a node without OUT edges.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable collection of all leaf nodes

      • roots

        default java.util.Collection<N> roots()
        Read-only accessor to all root nodes (if any). A root node is a node without IN edges.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable collection of all root nodes

      • contains

        boolean contains​(N node)
        Checks if this graph contains a particular node
        Parameters:
        node - the node to search for
        Returns:
        true if node was found in the graph

      • nodeFactory

        NodeFactory nodeFactory()
        The node factory used to instantiate nodes for this node set / graph.
        Returns:
        the node factory

      • addNode

        void addNode​(N node)
        Use this method to add nodes into a graph. This method is invoked by NodeFactory.makeNode(...) methods at node instantiation time, so that there is usually no need to call it explicitly.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to add to the graph

      • removeNode

        void removeNode​(N node)
        Use this method to remove a node from a node set.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to remove from the graph

      • nNodes

        int nNodes()
        The size of this node set.
        Returns:
        the number of nodes in this set

        N findNode​(java.lang.String id)
        Finds an Node based on its unique ID.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
